Title: IAEA Mission Finds Ghana Committed to Nuclear and Radiation Safet...
Description: An International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) team of experts has commended Ghana for its commitment to the continuous improvement of nuclear and radiation safety as the country advances its plans to develop a nuclear power programme.

Title: What is Soil Erosion? How Can Nuclear Techniques Help to Identify...
Description: Soil erosion, the most common type of land degradation is a process that removes the upper layer of soil, from which plants get most of their nutrients and water.

Title: IAEA Profile: Harnessing Technology to Build Connections and Prot...
Description: I was fascinated by the idea that someone on one side of the world could communicate with someone on the other side because of technology. It really spoke to me,' says Rutendo Zvirawa, reflecting on what inspired her to pursue information technology.

Title: Bolivia to Strengthen Cancer Control Systems Based on Review Miss...
Description: Bolivia has taken a critical step towards strengthening its cancer control system by hosting an imPACT Review mission led by the IAEA, the World Health Organization (WHO), and the International Agency for Research on Cancer (IARC).

Title: IAEA Mission Says Bulgaria is Committed to a High Level of Nuclea...
Description: An International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) team of experts said Bulgaria has a comprehensive and robust regulatory framework for nuclear and radiation safety covering all facilities and activities.

Title: IAEA Completes International Physical Protection Advisory Service...
Description: An IAEA team of experts has concluded an International Physical Protection Advisory Service mission in Zimbabwe. The mission, conducted at the request of the Government of Zimbabwe, took place from 18 November to 29 November 2024.

Title: Update 262 – IAEA Director General Statement on Situation in Ukra...
Description: Ukraine’s three operating nuclear power plants (NPPs) reduced their electricity generation this morning following renewed attacks on the country’s energy infrastructure that further endangered nuclear safety during the military conflict, Director General Rafael Mariano Grossi of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) said.

Title: IAEA Concludes a Long Term Operation Safety Review at the Kingdom...
Description: An International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) team of experts today completed a review of long term operational safety of the Borssele Nuclear Power Plant (NPP) in the Kingdom of the Netherlands.

Title: Do You Know How Nuclear Technology Impacts Our Lives?
Description: Discover how nuclear science is shaping a safer, healthier, and more sustainable world. From enhancing cancer care and food safety to protecting ecosystems and improving water management, nuclear techniques are driving innovative solutions to global challenges.

Title: IAEA and Anglo American Launch Research Project Under Atoms4Food ...
Description: The IAEA and Anglo American announced a new partnership for a research project to fight soil salinization, under the joint FAO and IAEA Atoms4Food initiative that aims to address growing hunger around the world.

Title: Ministerial Declaration Adopted on Importance of Nuclear Science ...
Description: IAEA Member States have adopted a declaration recognizing the important role of nuclear science, technology and applications in addressing current and evolving global challenges. The declaration was unanimously adopted at the IAEA Ministerial Conference on Nuclear Science, Technology and Applications and the Technical Cooperation Programme in Vienna this morning.

Title: VIDEO: How the IAEA and Nuclear Techniques Support a Sustainable ...
Description: Nuclear science and technology play a significant role in improving the lives and well-being of people worldwide, especially in the fields of health, food and agriculture and the environment.

Title: How the IAEA and Nuclear Techniques Support a Sustainable Future
Description: Nuclear science and technology play a significant role in improving the lives and well-being of people worldwide, especially in the fields of health, food and agriculture and the environment.

Title: IAEA to Host Ministerial Conference on Nuclear Science and Techno...
Description: The 2024 Ministerial Conference on Nuclear Science, Technology and Applications and the Technical Cooperation Programme will take place on 26-28 November 2024 at the IAEA’s headquarters in Vienna, Austria.

Title: IAEA Mission Reviews Republic of Korea’s Regulatory Framework for...
Description: An International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) team of experts noted that the Republic of Korea demonstrates a high level of nuclear safety through its independent regulatory body and mature regulatory systems, promoting a strong safety culture. The team also identified some areas for further enhancements and encouraged the country to further align its regulatory framework with the IAEA safety standards.

Title: Update 261 – IAEA Director General Statement on Situation in Ukra...
Description: Nuclear safety and security 'remains in jeopardy' at Ukraine’s Zaporizhzhya Nuclear Power Plant (ZNPP), Director General Rafael Mariano Grossi told this week’s IAEA Board of Governors meeting, as the facility twice lost the connection to its only remaining 750 kilovolt (kV) power line within a few days.

Title: IAEA Sees Operational Safety Commitment at Hungary’s Paks Nuclear...
Description: An IAEA team of experts stated that the operator of Paks Nuclear Power Plant in Hungary has demonstrated a commitment to operational safety. The team also encouraged the operator to continue improvements in areas such as training on preventative measures and documentation to reduce the risk of human error.
